document_data.caption: A map showing the Land of the Yak-Men in northeast Zakhara.
document_data.name: Land of the Yak-Men
document_data.mainbody: The '''Land of the Yak-Men''' was the term for the geographical region controlled by the [[Yikarian Empire]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}{{Cite dragon/241/Campaign Classics: The Roof of the World}}
document_data.Geography:
The southwestern arm of the [[World Pillar Mountains]] extended south into [[Zakhara]] from the junction of the continents of [[Faer√ªn]] and [[Kara-Tur]] with the Land of Fate. Most, if not all, of this arm of the vast mountain range fell under the domain of the Yikarian Empire. Additionally, their reach extended down the slopes of the mountains into the far northeastern reaches of Zakhara at the border with [[Konigheim]] and the [[Utter East]].

From a [[Zakharan (ethnicity)|Zakharan's]] standpoint, the Land of the Yak-Men abutted the forbidding desert wasteland known as the [[Haunted Lands]]. Due east it abutted the [[Jungle of Monsters]].<ref>
document_data.Inhabitants: In addition to the [[yak-folk]] who dominated the land, several other creatures could be found wandering the terrain. These included [[snow leopard]]s, [[yeti]]s, [[mountain goat]]s, [[musk oxen]], and even a few [[humans]].
